dt: {bc}to make a partial change in {bc}make different in some attribute or characteristic
{bc}to exhibit divergence in structural or physiological characters from the typical form

pt: {sc}change{/sc} {sc}alter{/sc} {sc}vary{/sc} {sc}modify{/sc} mean to make or become different. {sc}change{/sc} implies making either an essential difference often amounting to a loss of original identity or a substitution of one thing for another.

pt.t: {it}changed{/it} the shirt for a larger size

pt: {sc}alter{/sc} implies a difference in some particular respect without suggesting loss of identity.
{sc}vary{/sc} stresses a breaking away from sameness, duplication, or exact repetition.
{sc}modify{/sc} suggests a difference that limits, restricts, or adapts to a new purpose.

pt.t: {it}modified{/it} the building for use by the disabled

et: Middle English {it}varien{/it}, borrowed from Anglo-French or Latin; Anglo-French {it}varier{/it}, borrowed from Latin {it}variāre{/it} "to mark with contrasting colors, give variety to, make changeable," derivative of {it}varius{/it} "having contrasting colors, of different kinds, changeable," of uncertain origin
shortdef: to make a partial change in : make different in some attribute or characteristic
to make differences between items in : diversify
